lead_paragraph: An article on Tuesday about the upgrading of sports programs in the State University of New York system omitted two state university systems that did not have athletics programs in Division I of the National Collegiate Athletic Association in the 1980s. Besides Alaska and New York, North Dakota and South Dakota also did not have any state universities or colleges in Division I during that period. The article also misstated the title once held by the person who is investigating the Binghamton University sports program. Judith S. Kaye, who was not identified by name in the article, was New York State’s former chief judge; there is no “chief justice” in New York.
